intro: Lastrea denticulata, commonly known as the serrated lastrea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting to poor soil conditions through its extensive root system. Lastrea denticulata is often used in rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
